definition: Ali Baba, character from The Arabian Nights
Alibaba, PRC e-commerce company
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
Li (surname)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: This will give Yahoo direct and indirect ownership of 37 per cent of Alibaba.com.
sentences.chinese: 此舉將令雅虎直接和間接持有阿里巴巴37%的股權。

sentences.english: Taobao is run bye-commerce powerhouse Alibaba. com.
sentences.chinese: 淘寶網是由電子商務阿里巴巴網站運作的。

sentences.english: As part of that deal, Alibaba also agreed to take control of Yahoo’s Chinese language Web site.
sentences.chinese: 作爲交易的一部分，阿里巴巴同意接管雅虎中文網站。

sentences.english: Ali Baba and Morgiana lived happily ever after.
sentences.chinese: 從此以後，阿里巴巴和瑪吉安娜過着幸福的生活。

sentences.english: "Baa, Baa"cry his little lambs, On the farm of Ali Ba-ba.
sentences.chinese: 在阿里巴巴的農場裏，小羊羔咩咩叫。

sentences.english: Alibaba is China's No. 1 e-commerce company.
sentences.chinese: 阿里巴巴則是中國最大的電子商務公司。

sentences.english: So what does Damodaran think Alibaba's share should be worth?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，達摩達蘭認爲阿里巴巴的股票價值幾何呢？

sentences.english: For team management, Alibaba has a unique system of performance appraisal.
sentences.chinese: 對於團隊管理，阿里巴巴有獨具特色的績效考覈制度。

sentences.english: A clever slave-girl helps Ali Baba escape from the 40 thieves.
sentences.chinese: 一個聰明的女奴幫助阿里巴巴擺脫了40大盜。

sentences.english: "We are emptying the cave of Ali Baba, " says Guilio Tremonti, Italy's finance minister.
sentences.chinese: 意大利財政部部長特雷蒙蒂宣稱在阿里巴巴沒有資金。

sentences.english: I didn't know Mr. Ma Yun is the founder of Alibaba. com.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道馬雲先生是阿里巴巴的創始人。

sentences.english: Alibaba has also outflanked [8] the opposition in online payments.
sentences.chinese: 在在線付款方面，阿里巴巴也有過人之處。

sentences.english: Whether Alibaba can thrive abroad is another matter.
sentences.chinese: 而阿里巴巴能否在海外耀武揚威，那是另一回事。

sentences.english: also remains committed to expanding overseas, Mr.
sentences.chinese: 衛哲說，阿里巴巴依然堅持向海外擴張。

sentences.english: As she was clever, she understood what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 因爲瑪琪安娜很聰明，她瞭解阿里巴巴的意思。

sentences.english: A villager sold the lot on Alibaba. com.
sentences.chinese: 後來一個村民在阿里巴巴上賣出去了很多。

definition: Ali (proper name)/Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib (c. 600-661), cousin, aid and son-in-law of the Prophet Mohammed 穆罕默德, the fourth Caliph 哈里發|哈里发 of Islam, reigned 656-661, and the first Imam 伊瑪目|伊玛目 of Shia Islam/Ngari prefecture in Tibet, Tibetan: Mnga' ris
Ant Financial Services Group, an affiliate company of Alibaba 阿里巴巴[A1 li3 ba1 ba1]
Baidu, Internet portal and search engine, www.baidu.com, listed as BIDU on NASDAQ since 1999
see 騰訊控股有限公司|腾讯控股有限公司[Teng2 xun4 Kong4 gu3 You3 xian4 Gong1 si1]
e-commerce (abbr. for 電子商務|电子商务[dian4 zi3 shang1 wu4])/(old) to negotiate by telegram or telephone
Amazon
Wal-Mart, Walmart (retailer)
e-commerce
to invest
Yahoo, Internet portal
Google, Internet company and search engine
Ma Huateng aka Pony Ma (1971-), Chinese business magnate, CEO of Tencent
SenseTime, artificial intelligence company focused on computer vision and deep learning technologies, founded in Hong Kong in 2014
to retail/to sell individually or in small quantities
NetEase
Sougou (searching dog) search engine, www.sogou.com
